intro: Minuartia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically fleshy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. Minuartia macrocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in cold climates with limited nutrients.
